document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Sharp, D. S.
bibRefCitation.refString: Sharp, D. S. (1883) Biologia Centrali-Americana, Insecta, Coleoptera, Staphylinidae. 1 (2), 145 - 312, pls. 5 - 7.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to Central America.

bibRefCitation.author: Mannerheim, C. G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Mannerheim, C. G. (1830) Precis d'un nouvel arrangement de la famille des brachelytres, de l'ordre des insectes coleopteres. St. Petersbourg. 87 pp.

subSubSection.paragraph: 7 species are included in this genus from South America.
South America: Brazil , Paraguay , Chile , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Oriental , Australian.

bibRefCitation.author: Mulsant, E. & Rey, C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Mulsant, E. & Rey, C. (1875 e) Tribe des brevipennes: Famille des aleochariens. Suite. Sixieme branche - Aleocharaires (suite). Annales de la Societe Linneenne de Lyon (n. s.), 21, 1 - 403, pl. 1 - 5. [Note: nominal year of publication 1874]

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Calodera nigrata Fairmaire & Laboulbène, 1856
5 species are included in this genus from the West Indies.
Key: Pace 2001b: 431 (some species of the genus).

subSubSection.paragraph: 6 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.
Characters/Description: Lynch-Arribálzaga 1884: 79 (characters); Fenyes 1920: 340 (characters); Ashe 2002b: 125 (characters in key).
Key: Lynch-Arribálzaga 1884: 80 (species of Buenos Aires province , Argentina ).

subSubSection.paragraph: (characters in key), 126 (characters); Ashe 2002b: 125 (characters in key); Gusarov 2003e: 15 (characters). Key: Fenyes 1920: 363 (subgenera). Distribution. Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Panama . South America: Colombia , Brazil , Chile , Argentina . Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Oriental, Australian.
58 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.

Key: Klimaszewski & Sturm 1991: 3 (Colombian species associate to
Espeletia
flowers of the Paramo region).
South America: Colombia , Ecuador , Peru , Brazil , Chile , Argentina .

subSubSection.paragraph: 1 species is included in this genus from Central America.
